question: What percentage of surgical randomized controlled trials are discontinued early? Answer with Yes or No.

content.source_1: Of these, 21% (81/395) were discontinued early, most commonly owing to poor recruitment (44%, 36/81).
content.source_2: In a multicenter registry analysis of surgical randomized controlled trials initiated after 2010, 52% were discontinued prior to completion, largely due to inadequate accrual.
content.source_3: CONCLUSIONS One in five surgical randomised controlled trials are discontinued early, one in three completed trials remain unpublished, and investigators of unpublished studies are frequently not contactable.
content.source_4: Restricting the cohort to high-risk surgical subspecialties launched between 2012 and 2018, nearly one in two trials were stopped early, with interim efficacy and safety boundaries cited more often than recruitment issues.
